page.title: 01A Rural Haven
page.content: The greater part of this block is taken up by Bishop's Wood which is a coniferous wood. It covers mainly the east and south-east corner. The whole block is predominantly rural in character, and very sparsely populated. There is a concentration of buildings in square five of this block. These constitute the area of Chipnall there, there is a sawmill and a small number of houses, so few in fact that it cannot even be termed a village. Farms can be seen scattered over the whole area; Golden Hill Farm, The Nook Farm, Lipley Hall Farm; utilizing most of the land with both pasture and arable farming. The area is very limited in amenities and services to the public, so the inhabitants use those of the nearest town, which is in this case Market Drayton. The community is on the
